instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
All S5 rails are present. No water damage. Can fin the short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>. 


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Short means what?
Post exact value to ground, ohm scale.
Do you get at least a pulse on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 0.5ohms to ground. Not getting pulse on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>. not triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Half ohm is low enough to heat something injecting voltage there.
Start with 1V and go up...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: already tried. but seems nothing heat up except cables i am injecting with. Tried up to 3V, same result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Let ampers limit at max on lab power supply; and start with low voltage.

You are in the case where high current is required.
I already posted links for 20-40A power supplies on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Something must absolutely get hot....inspect caps by Audio IC common short on 13" unibodies

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: checked, injecting 2.43Amps with 4V through <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> pin 1 and absolutely nothing is getting not warm. checked everything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C6213</CAPACITOR> was the problem. Thank you. U were right it was getting very hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> shorted, no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
